title: [DO NOT REVIEW] Add JUnit 5 to geode-junit and geode-core
body:
- Make the JUnit 5 API available to all modules by adding it to the
  geode-junit API.
- Use Jupiter and Vintage engines to run all test types in geode-junit
  and geode-core.
- Update ConcurrencyRuleTest assertions to match those now thrown by
  AssertJ
  - ConcurrencyRule uses AssertJ to make assertions.
  - ConcurrencyRuleTest validates the type and messages of assertion
    failures thrown by ConcurrencyRule.
  - JUnit 5 puts opentest4j on the classpath.
  - When AssertJ finds opentest4j on the classpath, it configures itself
    to throw opentest4j assertion failures, which differ in type and
    message from the ones it throws when opentest4j is not present.

title: GEODE-7458: Adding option in gfsh command "start gateway sender" to control clearing of existing queues
body:
In this PR clearing of queue is added as option at starting of gateway sender.
Also behavior of parallel and serial gateway senders are now aligned.
Due to that, queue is no longer cleared at stopping of gateway sender,
since we now have option whether we want it to be cleared or restored, at restarting of gateway sender.

title: GEODE-7485: REST URLs accept dots in trailing parameters
body:
By default, when Spring parses a request mapping parameter at the end of a URL, it treats the last dot in the paramater value to be the start of a file extension, and discards the 'extension" before passing the parameter to the handler method.

Several of our configurable items allow dots in their IDs. And several of our REST request mappings place those IDs at the end of the URL. In those cases, Spring's default behavior truncates the ID at the last dot, and passes the truncated ID to the request handler. As a result, the request fails.                                                

This commit configure all current management REST API request mappings to allow dots in their final parameters.

Co-authored-by: Dale Emery <demery@pivotal.io>
Co-authored-by: Jinmei Liao <jiliao@pivotal.io>
Co-authored-by: Darrel Schneider <dschneider@pivotal.io>

title: GEODE-4187: Fix PersistentColocatedPartitionedRegionDistributedTest
body:
Flakiness was fixed by:
* Clean up messy uses of AsyncInvocation
* Replace uses of Thread.sleep with Mockito.verify using timeout()
* Use GeodeAwaitility timeout for all timeouts

High level changes to tests and product code:
* Rename PersistentColocatedPartitionedRegionDUnitTest to 
  PersistentColocatedPartitionedRegionDistributedTest
* Extract single-JVM tests to colocation integration tests
  (ModifyColocationIntegrationTest, PersistentColocationIntegrationTest)
* Move ColocationLogger to internal.cache.partitioned.colocation package
* Extract factory and interfaces from ColocationLogger
* Create unit tests for ColocationLogger and factory
* Pass ColocationLoggerFactory into PartitionedRegion constructor
* Use ColocationLogger via interfaces instead of implementations
* Clean up PartitionedRegionTest (unit test)
* Clean up colocation IllegalStateException message
* Add getLogger(Class) to LogService

Update PersistentColocatedPartitionedRegionDistributedTest:
* Make the code readable and understandable
* Update to non-deprecated APIs
* Inline super-class and lots of methods
* Use TemporaryFolder Rule for all files
* Use RestoreSystemProperties Rule instead of finally blocks
* Replace MockAppender with cleaner inlined use of Mockito
* Clean up usages of AsyncInvocation
* Replace messy try-catch blocks with AssertJ catchThrowable
* Throw failures and unexpected exceptions instead of catching them to invoke fail
* Use descriptive variable and method names
* Replace use of Admin API for shutdown with Cache.close()
* Use lambdas instead of SerializableRunnable variables
* Use lambdas instead of lots of tiny inner-classes
* Use tearDown instead of try-finally blocks
* Reimplement broken waits with Awaitility

title: GEODE-7344: DSFID implements BasicSerializable
body:
[GEODE-7344](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GEODE-7344)

As part of eliminating `TcpServer` dependency on `geode-core`, this ticket removes `TcpServer` dependencies on `DataSerializable`.

The way we did that was to change the 6 message types used to talk to `TcpServer` so instead of deriving from `DataSerializable`they now derive from a new `BasicSerializable` interface.

That interface is made a base for `DataSerializableFixedID`. Then we modified `geode-serialization` so it handles any `BasicSerializable` i.e. both the base type and the derived (`DataSerializableFixedID`) type. This entailed a few changes up in `geode-core`: primarily in `InternalDataSerializer`.

The six message types that are now `BasicSerializable` are:

* `VersionRequest`/`Response`
* `InfoRequest`/`Response`
* `ShutdownRequest`/`Response`

With these changes, the on-the-wire format of the new `BasicSerializable` is the same as the old `DataSerializable`. This lets a new Geode and an old Geode communicate.

With this PR, the `TcpServer` package no longer depends on anything in `geode-core` and `TcpServer` and friends (in `org.apache.geode.distributed.internal.tcpserver`)  are ready to move to their very own new module (in a future PR).

title: GEODE-7470: Fix LogConsumerDistributedTest
body:
Some of the nested test classes were not awaiting the completion of the
AsyncInvocation.

Use AtomicReference instead of volatile for test fields.

The actual fix is adding this line to each of the nested tests:
```
asyncInvocation.get().await();
```

On this branch, LogConsumerDistributedTest passes 1000 dunitrunner runs as well as cross-section 16 1000.

This PR also fixes [GEODE-7467](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GEODE-7467) which was occurring when the AsyncInvocations logged the error message after LogConsumerDistributedTest completed. Awaiting for completion of all AsyncInvocations prevents this late logging.

title: GEODE-7475: Include remote stack trace in AsyncInvocation timeout
body:
Update AsyncInvocation and dunit with these changes:
1) Add stack trace of remote thread as the cause of an AsyncInvocation TimeoutException.
2) Clean up AsyncInvocation and SerializableRunnable/SerializableCallable hierarchy of classes.
3) New tests for StackTrace, VM.dumpThreads, and AsyncInvocation asyncTimeoutHandler.
4) Deprecate and reorganize some additional dunit methods that are either not used or have a newer preferred alternative.
5) Trigger remote VM to dump all threads to stdout when an AsyncInvocation times out.

Presently, when an AsyncInvocation times out, it throws a TimeoutException that doesn't really provide enough information to debug the underlying cause.

title: GEODE-7344: break dependencies on DataSerializer
body:
This PR implements the first half of [GEODE-7344](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GEODE-7344), to wit, eliminating dependencies on `DataSerializer` from classes in the `org.apache.geode.distributed.internal.tcpserver` package.

The main change is that now we are injecting an `ObjectSerializer` and an `ObjectDeserializer` into the `TcpClient` constructor in order to break the dependency from the latter to the `DataSerializer` class. Also `TcpServer` got the same treatment!

I'd like to get this approved and merged before tackling the harder second half (eliminating dependencies on `DataSerializable`).

title: GEODE-7450 SSL peerAppDataBuffer expansion needs work
body:
The expansion logic for the decrypted buffer in NioSslEngine was
expanding the buffer to twice its old capacity and wouldn't go
beyond that.  Some ciphers will compress data a lot more than that, so
we need to continually increase available space in the decryption buffer
if the SslEngine reports a BUFFER_OVERFLOW status.  The changes in
this commit do that by always doubling the available space in the
decryption buffer in response to a BUFFER_OVERFLOW.

Along with that I found it unnecessary to take preemptive action to
increase the size of the buffer and deleted that code.

title: GEODE-7457: publish one wiki page per release instead of overwriting
body:
Problems with having only two wiki pages (one generated from master and one from develop) had two drawbacks:
1) could not generate docs until after release shipped
2) could not link to previous doc version when they get overwritten, because confluence doesn't seem to support a url syntax to refer to page version in history, and even if it did, it would be clunky
3) it was confusing that develop was a sub-page of 1.10.0
 
Now, one wiki page per release version must be (manually) allocated and added to the script, but now it generate the wiki page from develop, master, or an active release branch, so that docs can be made available earlier in the release process.

See new page tree at https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/GEODE/develop+Management+REST+API+-+v1

title: GEODE-7345: break dependency on SocketCreator
body:
[GEODE-7345](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GEODE-7345)

In preparation to put `TcpServer` and `TcpClient` into their own module, this PR breaks dependencies from those classes, to classes in `geode-core`.

In the nascent `geode-tcp-server` module, replace usages of the (broad) `SocketCreator` class (from `geode-core`) with usages of a new (narrow) [`TcpSocketCreator`](geode-core/src/main/java/org/apache/geode/distributed/internal/tcpserver/TcpSocketCreator.java) interface.

This means injecting (a reference to an object implementing that interface) everywhere we were formerly creating an instance of `SocketCreator`. You'll see many examples of `TcpClient` construction taking a `TcpSocket` creator ref now.

The resulting Dockerfile is committed back to master, but I'm not sure if or how develop should be affected as a result of a release...

title: GEODE-6818: Fix PutAllClientServerDistributedTest
body:
GEODE-6818: Fix PutAllClientServerDistributedTest
    
Overhaul test and fix sources of flakiness (wait/notify and sleeps).
    
* Replace object wait/notify with CountDownLatch(es)
* Replace sleeps with Awaitility
* Inline super-class and lots of methods
* Remove unused or unnecessary code
* Update deprecated API usage
* Update to AssertJ and Awaitility

title: GEODE-7431: limit Benchmarks to three-at-a-time to stay within quota
body:
For example, https://concourse.apachegeode-ci.info/teams/main/pipelines/apache-develop-main/jobs/Benchmark/builds/677 failed because there were already 3 benchmarks jobs running at the time.

Since the quota is 40 and each benchmark job uses 12, this PR restricts `max_in_flight` to `3`

title: Increment stress-new-test from 2h15m to 6h to accomodate long tests
body: We have had issues with UpgradeTest changes blowing out the Concourse timeout in StressNewTest. Bump the timeout limit.
